sen.j: 柳原資綱（やなぎわら すけつな、応永26年（1419年） - 文亀元年（1501年）6月27日 (旧暦)）は室町時代の公家、柳原家当主。
sen.e: Suketsuna YANAGIWARA (1419-June 27, 1501) was a kuge (court noble) and a lord of the Yanagiwara family who lived in the Muromachi period.
Suketsuna YANAGIWARA (1419-June 27, 1501) was a Kugyo (court noble) and lord of the Yanagiwara family who lived during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: changed "in" to "during"; changed "kuge" to "Kugyo" for consistency with other articles
sen.e: Suketsuna YANAGIWARA (1419 - July 22, 1501) was a Kugyo (court noble) and lord of the Yanagiwara family who lived during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 父は柳原行光、母は日野西資国女、子に柳原量光、柳原光秀ら。
sen.e: His father was Yukimitsu (行光) YANAGIWARA, his mother was a daughter of Sukekuni HINONISHI, and his children were Kazumitsu YANAGIWARA, Mitsuhide (光秀) YANAGIWARA, and so on.
sen.cmt: 行光、光秀の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His father was Yukimitsu (行光) YANAGIWARA, his mother was a daughter of Sukekuni HINONISHI, and among his children were Kazumitsu YANAGIWARA and Mitsuhide (光秀) YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: changed "and so on" to "among his children"
sen.e: His father was Yukimitsu (行光) YANAGIWARA, his mother was a daughter of Sukekuni HINONISHI, and among his children were Kazumitsu YANAGIWARA and Mitsuhide (光秀) YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は従一位権大納言。
sen.e: His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state).
His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: fixed "Gon Dainagon" description to match the word list
sen.e: His official court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Career
Career
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Career
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応永26年（1419年）、柳原行光の子として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1419 he was born as a son of Yukimitsu YANAGIWARA.
In 1419 Suketsuna was born as a son of Yukimitsu YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: changed "he" to "Suketsuna" since this is a new paragraph
sen.e: In 1419 Suketsuna was born as a son of Yukimitsu YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文安6年（1449年）3月28日 (旧暦)、参議に任じられる。
sen.e: On April 29, 1449, he was assigned to Sangi (councilor).
On April 29, 1449, he was assigned to Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On April 29, 1449, he was assigned to Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応仁の乱頃より柳原家の家計は各地の知行分が押領され、困窮するようになった。
sen.e: Since around the Onin War, the Yanagiwara's family finances became worse because its chigyo (enfeoffment) in various places were arrogated.
sen.cmt: 押領は横領の誤記と判断しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: From around the time of the Onin War, the Yanigiwara's family finances became depleted due to various parts of the chigyo (fief) being usurped.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more understandably; 困窮するようになった→"depleted; 知行分→parts of the fief; 横領→"usurped"; changed "enfeoffment" to "fief"
sen.e: From around the time of the Onin War, the Yanigiwara's family finances became depleted due to various parts of the chigyo (fief) being usurped.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、主要な経済基盤のあった因幡国の知行分に直接下向、子の量光と共に所領の経営を行った。
sen.e: Therefore, he went down to the chigyo in Inaba Province which was the main financial base and managed shoryo (territory) with his son Kazumitsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suketsuna went down to his chigyo in Inaba Province where his main financial base was located and managed his shoryo (territory) with his son Kazumitsu.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Suketsuna went down to his chigyo in Inaba Province where his main financial base was located and managed his shoryo (territory) with his son Kazumitsu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明 (日本)6年（1478年）頃からはほぼ毎年、因幡在国と上洛を繰り返すようになった。
sen.e: Almost every year since around 1478, he repeated to stay at Inaba Province and go back to Kyoto.
From around 1478, Suketsuna repeated this trip nearly every year, travelling to Inaba Province and then returning to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: From around 1478, Suketsuna repeated this trip nearly every year, traveling to Inaba Province and then returning to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 自らの在国中は子の量光を上洛させ、量光の在国中は自らが上洛し、宮中に奉仕する形を採り、所領の経営を行った。
sen.e: He had his son Kazumitsu go up to Kyoto when he stayed at the territory, while when Kazumitsu stayed at the territory he himself went up to Kyoto and served for imperial court, in which way he managed the territory.

Suketsuna managed his territory by having his son Kazumitsu travel to Kyoto when Suketsuna stayed behind, and when Suketsuna travelled to Kyoto to serve in the imperial court, Kazumitsu would stay in the territory.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more understandably and smoothly
sen.e: Suketsuna managed his territory by having his son Kazumitsu travel to Kyoto when Suketsuna stayed behind, and when Suketsuna traveled to Kyoto to serve in the Imperial Court, Kazumitsu would stay in the territory.
sen.cmt: Imperial Court としました。

sen.j: 因幡在国時は法美郡百谷（現・鳥取市）の地に屋敷を構えていたという。
sen.e: It is said that when he stayed at the Inaba Province he had a residence at Momodani, Homi County (Tottori City at present).
While Suketsuna was in Inaba Province he allegedly had a residence in Momodani, Homi County (present day Tottori City).
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: While Suketsuna was in Inaba Province he allegedly had a residence in Momodani, Homi County (present day Tottori City).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明14年（1482年）、従一位権大納言に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1482 he was assigned to Juichii Gon Dainagon.
It was 1482 when he was assigned to Juichii Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: It was 1482 when he was assigned to Juichii Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 所領経営で因幡に在国する傍ら、上洛時には柳原家の体面を保つため、月次和漢会などに出席し、社交面でも活発に動いていた。
sen.e: He stayed at Inaba Province in order to manage the territory, on the other hand, when he stayed at Kyoto he was outgoing in society such as attending a monthly meeting of Japanese and Chinese classics in order to save face of the Yanagiwara family.

He stayed in Inaba Province to manage his territory, but when he went to Kyoto he was an outgoing member of society, attending such events as monthly Japanese and Chinese classics meetings in order to preserve the honor of the Yanagiwara family.
sen.cmt: 体面を保つ→"preserve the honor"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He stayed in Inaba Province to manage his territory, but when he went to Kyoto he was an outgoing member of society, attending such events as monthly Japanese and Chinese classics meetings in order to preserve the honor of the Yanagiwara family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただ、和漢はあまり上手ではなかったようで甘露寺親長からは「和漢ども堪能にあらざるか」と評されている。（『親長卿記』）
sen.e: However, he seemed to not to be good at Japanese and Chinese classics, and was commented by Chikanaga KANROJI that 'he is not good at Japanese and Chinese classics' ("Chikanaga kyo ki" (diary of Chikanaga KANROJI)).

He was apparently not very proficient at Japanese and Chinese classics, evidenced by a comment made by Chikanaga KANROJI in his diary that, "Suketsuna is not good at Japanese and Chinese classics" ("Chikanagak kyo ki" (Diary of Chikanaga KANROJI)).
sen.cmt: changed "he" inside quote to "Suketsuna"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: He was apparently not very proficient at Japanese and Chinese classics, evidenced by a comment made by Chikanaga KANROJI in his diary that, 'Suketsuna is not good at Japanese and Chinese classics' ("Chikanaga kyo ki" [Diary of Chikanaga KANROJI]).
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 明応元年の改元の際には「近江知行分が復活したならば、すぐさま上洛して父子共々朝政に奉仕する」と述べ、近江国の所領の復活を要請していた。
sen.e: At the time of changing the name of an era in 1492, he told that 'if our chigyo in Omi Province would be revived, I will soon go up to Kyoto and serve for government by the Imperial Court with my son,' and requested to revive the territory in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the of change eras in 1492, Suketsuna stated, "If our territory in Omi Province can be revived, I will leave straight for Kyoto to serve the government in the Imperial Court with my son," and applied to have his territory restored.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more understandably and smoothly
sen.e: At the of change eras in 1492, Suketsuna stated, 'If our territory in Omi Province can be revived, I will leave straight for Kyoto to serve the government in the Imperial Court with my son,' and applied to have his territory restored.
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。

sen.j: が、不可能と回答されたために新元号の勘者に選ばれていた息子の量光の上洛を拒否し、引き続き因幡に在国した。
sen.e: However, he was answered that it was impossible, so that he rejected that his son Kazumitsu, who was selected for the person who made a suggestion on a new name of an era, would go up to Kyoto and continued to stay at the Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When he received an answer that it was impossible, however, he refused to let his son Kazumitsu, who had been chosen to suggest the name of the new era, travel to Kyoto and they continued to stay in Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: When he received an answer that it was impossible, however, he refused to let his son Kazumitsu, who had been chosen to suggest the name of the new era, travel to Kyoto and they continued to stay in Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文亀元年（1501年）6月27日、丹州に滞在中に病没、享年83と高齢であった。
sen.e: On July 22, 1501, he died of a disease during his stay at Tanshu.
At the old age of 83, Suketsuna died of a disease during a stay in Tanshu on June 27, 1501.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally; combined with the sentence below for an improved flow; changed date to match the date at the beginning of the article
sen.e: At the old age of 83, Suketsuna died of a disease during a stay in Tanshu on July 22, 1501.
sen.cmt: 次セルと統合し、グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 三条西実隆からは「朝の大老なり」と評されている。
sen.e: He was described by Sanetaka SANJONISHI as 'He is Tairo (chief minister) of imperial court.'
Sanetaka SANJONISHI described Suketsuna as "the Tairo (chief minister) of imperial court."
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: Sanetaka SANJONISHI described Suketsuna as 'the Tairo (chief minister) of Imperial Court.'
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。
